title: Non-isotropic translation and modulation invariant Hilbert spaces
abstract:
Let $\mathcal H$ be a Hilbert space of distributions on $\mathbf R^d$ which
contains at least one non-zero element in $\mathscr D '(\mathbf R^d)$. If there
is a constant $C_0>0$ such that $$ \nm {e^{i\scal \cdo \xi}f(\cdo -x)}{\mathcal
H}\le C_0\nm f{\mathcal H}, \qquad f\in \mathcal H ,\ x,\xi \in \mathbf R^d, $$
then we prove that $\maclH = L^2(\mathbf R^d)$, with equivalent norms.
